intro: Hieracium dubium var. multiflorum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with basal leaves that are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are bright yellow, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, and it blooms from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, riverbanks, and woodland edges.
